arabic: الر ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ وَقُرْآنٍ مُّبِينٍ
english: Alif, Lam, Ra. (Only Allah and the Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him] know the real meaning.) These are the Verses of the (Glorious) Book and the Enlightening Qur’an.

arabic: رُّبَمَا يَوَدُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْ كَانُوا مُسْلِمِينَ
english: (Watching the scenes of Allah’s mercy on the believers in the Hereafter,) the disbelievers will persistently aspire: would that they were Muslims!

arabic: ذَرْهُمْ يَأْكُلُوا وَيَتَمَتَّعُوا وَيُلْهِهِمُ الْأَمَلُ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
english: (Feel not aggrieved.) Leave them. Let them eat (and drink) and make merry and let (their) false hopes keep them negligent (of the Hereafter). Then they will come to know (their end) soon.

arabic: وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا وَلَهَا كِتَابٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
english: And never have We destroyed any township, except that there was for them a known inscription (law, which they violated and met their fate).

arabic: مَّا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَأْخِرُونَ
english: No people can go beyond their appointed term, nor can they step back (under the law of rise and fall).

arabic: وَقَالُوا يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِي نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ الذِّكْرُ إِنَّكَ لَمَجْنُونٌ
english: And (the disbelievers) say (insolently): ‘O man on whom this Qur’an has been revealed, indeed you are insane.

arabic: لَّوْ مَا تَأْتِينَا بِالْمَلَائِكَةِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
english: Why do you not bring us angels if you are truthful?’

arabic: مَا نُنَزِّلُ الْمَلَائِكَةَ إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَمَا كَانُوا إِذًا مُّنظَرِينَ
english: We do not send down angels but with the (judgment of) truth (i.e., We send them down to execute the torment when its time approaches), and they are not granted respite at that time.

arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا الذِّكْرَ وَإِنَّا لَهُ لَحَافِظُونَ
english: Assuredly, We alone have revealed this Glorious Admonition (the Qur’an), and surely We alone will guard it.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ فِي شِيَعِ الْأَوَّلِينَ
english: And We indeed sent Messengers before you as well amongst the earlier generations.

arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
english: And there did not come to them any Messenger but they would mock him.

arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَسْلُكُهُ فِي قُلُوبِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
english: That is how We infuse this (mockery and ridicule) into the hearts of the sinners;

arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ ۖ وَقَدْ خَلَتْ سُنَّةُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
english: These people will not believe in this (Qur’an), and (this) is what has been the practice of the bygone people.

arabic: وَلَوْ فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَابًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ فَظَلُّوا فِيهِ يَعْرُجُونَ
english: And if We open to them some gate in the heaven (and also make this possible for them that) they keep ascending through (it) the whole day,

arabic: لَقَالُوا إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتْ أَبْصَارُنَا بَلْ نَحْنُ قَوْمٌ مَّسْحُورُونَ
english: (Even then) they will certainly say (this): ‘Our eyes have been hypnotized (through some magic trick and deceit), rather we are spellbound.’

arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا فِي السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجًا وَزَيَّنَّاهَا لِلنَّاظِرِينَ
english: And indeed, We brought into existence constellations in the heavens (in the form of galaxies to safeguard the planets), and adorned this (spatial universe) for the beholders.

arabic: وَحَفِظْنَاهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْطَانٍ رَّجِيمٍ
english: And We have ensured the protection of this (system of heavenly universe) from every outcast satan (i.e., from the destructive phenomenon of every rebellious force).

arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ اسْتَرَقَ السَّمْعَ فَأَتْبَعَهُ شِهَابٌ مُّبِينٌ
english: But anyone who tries to eavesdrop, an illuminating (i.e., blazing) meteor follows it.

arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَاهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ مَّوْزُونٍ
english: And We have spread out the earth (despite its being round), and We brought about firm mountains in it (by allying different elements together), and in it We provided means of growth to all species in (requisite) proportion.

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَعَايِشَ وَمَن لَّسْتُمْ لَهُ بِرَازِقِينَ
english: And in it We generated for you means of subsistence and also for those (human beings, animals and birds) whom you do not provide for.

arabic: وَإِن مِّن شَيْءٍ إِلَّا عِندَنَا خَزَائِنُهُ وَمَا نُنَزِّلُهُ إِلَّا بِقَدَرٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
english: And there is not a thing (in the universe) but that We have its treasures with Us, and We send it down only according to a fixed quantity.

arabic: وَأَرْسَلْنَا الرِّيَاحَ لَوَاقِحَ فَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَسْقَيْنَاكُمُوهُ وَمَا أَنتُمْ لَهُ بِخَازِنِينَ
english: And We send winds carrying the burden of clouds. Then We pour down water from the sky. Then it is you whom We give it to drink, and it is not you who maintain its reservoirs.

arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ نُحْيِي وَنُمِيتُ وَنَحْنُ الْوَارِثُونَ
english: And indeed, We alone give life and cause death, and We alone are the Inheritor (and the Owner of all).

arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا الْمُسْتَقْدِمِينَ مِنكُمْ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا الْمُسْتَأْخِرِينَ
english: And surely, We know those who lived before you, and We also know those who will come after you.

arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٌ
english: Verily, it is your Lord Who will gather them together (on the Day of Resurrection). Surely, He is Most Wise, All-Knowing.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ مِن صَلْصَالٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
english: And indeed, We originated man’s (chemical) genesis from that dry sounding clay which, (first) having grown old (and under the heat of the sun and other chemical and biological effects), had turned into black stinking mud.

arabic: وَالْجَانَّ خَلَقْنَاهُ مِن قَبْلُ مِن نَّارِ السَّمُومِ
english: And We created jinn before this from a smokeless blazing fire.

arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ إِنِّي خَالِقٌ بَشَرًا مِّن صَلْصَالٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
english: And (recall) when your Lord said to the angels: ‘I am about to create a human organism from old (and) black stinking, resounding mud.

arabic: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِي فَقَعُوا لَهُ سَاجِدِينَ
english: So when I accomplish the perfection of his (physical) constitution into his real being, and breathe My (divine) spirit into (the inner self of) this (human physical) organism, then fall down prostrate before him.’

arabic: فَسَجَدَ الْمَلَائِكَةُ كُلُّهُمْ أَجْمَعُونَ
english: So, (no sooner did the light of Allah’s effulgence illumine the human organism than) all the angels fell down in prostration together,

arabic: إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ أَن يَكُونَ مَعَ السَّاجِدِينَ
english: Except Iblis. He refused to join those who prostrated themselves.

arabic: قَالَ يَا إِبْلِيسُ مَا لَكَ أَلَّا تَكُونَ مَعَ السَّاجِدِينَ
english: (Allah) said: ‘O Iblis, what has happened to you that you have not joined those who have prostrated themselves?’

arabic: قَالَ لَمْ أَكُن لِّأَسْجُدَ لِبَشَرٍ خَلَقْتَهُ مِن صَلْصَالٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
english: (Iblis) replied: ‘I cannot be the one who should fall down prostrate before a human being You have created from old (and) black stinking, sounding mud.’

arabic: قَالَ فَاخْرُجْ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٌ
english: (Allah) said: ‘Then get out from here, for you are indeed the cursed one (the outcast).

arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ اللَّعْنَةَ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ
english: And, verily, the curse will (persistently) rest upon you till the Day of Recompense.’

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
english: He said: ‘O Lord, then grant me respite till the Day (when) people will be raised up (again).’

arabic: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ الْمُنظَرِينَ
english: Allah said: ‘So, indeed, you are amongst those granted respite,

arabic: إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْوَقْتِ الْمَعْلُومِ
english: Till the Day of the appointed time (Resurrection).’

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَا أَغْوَيْتَنِي لَأُزَيِّنَنَّ لَهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
english: Iblis said: ‘O Lord, because You have led me astray, I will (also) best adorn and embellish for them (the sins, revolts and violations) in the earth and will certainly lead all of them astray by all means,

arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنْهُمُ الْمُخْلَصِينَ
english: Except for those exalted servants of Yours who have attained freedom (from my deceits and intrigues of the ill-commanding selves).’

arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذَا صِرَاطٌ عَلَيَّ مُسْتَقِيمٌ
english: Allah said: ‘This (freedom from these deceits and intrigues) is the (very) path that leads straight to My Threshold.

arabic: إِنَّ عِبَادِي لَيْسَ لَكَ عَلَيْهِمْ سُلْطَانٌ إِلَّا مَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْغَاوِينَ
english: Surely, you will in no way be able to influence My servants (who have attained this freedom from you) except the misguided lot who have adopted your way.

arabic: وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمَوْعِدُهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
english: And verily, the promised place for all of them is Hell.

arabic: لَهَا سَبْعَةُ أَبْوَابٍ لِّكُلِّ بَابٍ مِّنْهُمْ جُزْءٌ مَّقْسُومٌ
english: It has seven doors; for each one a fixed portion of them has been specified.’

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
english: Indeed, the Godfearing will be amid Gardens and fountains.

arabic: ادْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَامٍ آمِنِينَ
english: (It will be said to them:) ‘Enter them peacefully, casting aside all fears.’

arabic: وَنَزَعْنَا مَا فِي صُدُورِهِم مِّنْ غِلٍّ إِخْوَانًا عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مُّتَقَابِلِينَ
english: And We shall remove from their breasts all spite that they had (in the world against one another due to misunderstanding). They shall be brothers seated on couches face to face (in Paradise).

arabic: لَا يَمَسُّهُمْ فِيهَا نَصَبٌ وَمَا هُم مِّنْهَا بِمُخْرَجِينَ
english: No discomfort will touch them, nor will they be driven out from there.

arabic: ۞ نَبِّئْ عِبَادِي أَنِّي أَنَا الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
english: (O Beloved!) Tell My servants: ‘Indeed, I am Most Forgiving, Ever-Merciful.’

arabic: وَأَنَّ عَذَابِي هُوَ الْعَذَابُ الْأَلِيمُ
english: And (also warn) that: ‘It is My torment which is the most grievous torment.’

arabic: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ عَن ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
english: And (also) relate to them the news about the guests of Ibrahim (Abraham).

arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا قَالَ إِنَّا مِنكُمْ وَجِلُونَ
english: When they came to Ibrahim (Abraham), they greeted (him with): ‘Peace.’ Ibrahim (Abraham) said: ‘We are feeling somewhat afraid of you.’

arabic: قَالُوا لَا تَوْجَلْ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ
english: (The guest angels) said: ‘Do not feel afraid. We give you the glad tidings of (the birth of) a son endowed with knowledge and wisdom.’

arabic: قَالَ أَبَشَّرْتُمُونِي عَلَىٰ أَن مَّسَّنِيَ الْكِبَرُ فَبِمَ تُبَشِّرُونَ
english: Ibrahim (Abraham) said: ‘You are giving me the glad tidings at a time when old age has already overtaken me. So what good news are you giving me now?’

arabic: قَالُوا بَشَّرْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ الْقَانِطِينَ
english: They said: ‘We give you the good news which is true. So do not lose hope.’

arabic: قَالَ وَمَن يَقْنَطُ مِن رَّحْمَةِ رَبِّهِ إِلَّا الضَّالُّونَ
english: Ibrahim (Abraham) said: ‘Who can lose hope of his Lord’s mercy except the strayed ones?’

arabic: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ
english: Ibrahim (Abraham) asked: ‘O deputed angels (sent by Allah), what other assignment do you have (to accomplish besides these glad tidings for which you have come)?’

arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِينَ
english: They said: ‘We have been sent towards a sinful people,

arabic: إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ إِنَّا لَمُنَجُّوهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
english: Except the family of Lut (Lot) all of whom We will indeed save,

arabic: إِلَّا امْرَأَتَهُ قَدَّرْنَا ۙ إِنَّهَا لَمِنَ الْغَابِرِينَ
english: With the exception of his wife. We have decided that she shall certainly be amongst those who stay back (to become the victims of the torment).’

arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ آلَ لُوطٍ الْمُرْسَلُونَ
english: Then, when those deputed (angels) came to the house of Lut (Lot),

arabic: قَالَ إِنَّكُمْ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ
english: Lut (Lot) said: ‘Indeed, you are (looking) strangers.’

arabic: قَالُوا بَلْ جِئْنَاكَ بِمَا كَانُوا فِيهِ يَمْتَرُونَ
english: They said: ‘(No indeed;) in fact we have come to you with the (punishment) about which these people have had doubts.

arabic: وَأَتَيْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ وَإِنَّا لَصَادِقُونَ
english: And we have brought you (the judgment of) the truth and we are certainly truthful.

arabic: فَأَسْرِ بِأَهْلِكَ بِقِطْعٍ مِّنَ اللَّيْلِ وَاتَّبِعْ أَدْبَارَهُمْ وَلَا يَلْتَفِتْ مِنكُمْ أَحَدٌ وَامْضُوا حَيْثُ تُؤْمَرُونَ
english: So set off with your family sometime during the night, and follow them in the rear, and none of you should (even) look back, and proceed to the place (where) you have been commanded.’

arabic: وَقَضَيْنَا إِلَيْهِ ذَٰلِكَ الْأَمْرَ أَنَّ دَابِرَ هَـٰؤُلَاءِ مَقْطُوعٌ مُّصْبِحِينَ
english: And We informed Lut (Lot) of this judgment through Revelation that the root of these people would be cut off the moment it dawns.

arabic: وَجَاءَ أَهْلُ الْمَدِينَةِ يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ
english: And the people of the city (possessed by their lust) approached (Lut [Lot]), rejoicing.

arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ هَـٰؤُلَاءِ ضَيْفِي فَلَا تَفْضَحُونِ
english: Lut (Lot) said: ‘Surely, they are my guests, so do not put me to shame (about them).

arabic: وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَلَا تُخْزُونِ
english: And fear (the wrath of) Allah and do not humiliate me.’

arabic: قَالُوا أَوَلَمْ نَنْهَكَ عَنِ الْعَالَمِينَ
english: Those (lost in wickedness) said: ‘(O Lut [Lot],) did we not forbid you (to provide protection to) all the people of the world?’

arabic: قَالَ هَـٰؤُلَاءِ بَنَاتِي إِن كُنتُمْ فَاعِلِينَ
english: Lut (Lot) said: ‘There are my (people’s) daughters. If you desire to do something (then marry them instead of perpetrating indecency).’

arabic: لَعَمْرُكَ إِنَّهُمْ لَفِي سَكْرَتِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
english: (O Glorious Beloved!) By your (sacred) life, surely these people (too) are wandering astray, possessed by their lust (like the people of Lut [Lot]).

arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّيْحَةُ مُشْرِقِينَ
english: So, the blazing blast seized them at sunrise.

arabic: فَجَعَلْنَا عَالِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِّن سِجِّيلٍ
english: And We turned their town upside down and rained upon them stones of baked clay.

arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّلْمُتَوَسِّمِينَ
english: Verily, in this (occurrence) there are signs for those who possess the ability to probe into reality.

arabic: وَإِنَّهَا لَبِسَبِيلٍ مُّقِيمٍ
english: And truly that town lies along a frequented highway.

arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
english: Surely, in this (episode of the people of Lut [Lot]), there is a sign of (warning) for the believers.

arabic: وَإِن كَانَ أَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ لَظَالِمِينَ
english: And, in reality, the dwellers of al-Ayka (the Thick Wood) too were hardened wrongdoers.

arabic: فَانتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ وَإِنَّهُمَا لَبِإِمَامٍ مُّبِينٍ
english: So We avenged Ourselves on them (as well), and (archeological remains of) both these (towns still exist) on the highway.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ أَصْحَابُ الْحِجْرِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
english: And no doubt, the people of the valley of al-Hijr (the Rock) too denied the Messengers.

arabic: وَآتَيْنَاهُمْ آيَاتِنَا فَكَانُوا عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ
english: And We (also) bestowed upon them Our signs, but they persisted in turning away from them.

arabic: وَكَانُوا يَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ الْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا آمِنِينَ
english: And they used to carve out houses in the mountains without any threat and fear.

arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّيْحَةُ مُصْبِحِينَ
english: And the dreadful blast seized them (as well) the moment it dawned.

arabic: فَمَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
english: So (the riches) they used to earn could not repel (Allah’s punishment) from them.

arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ ۗ وَإِنَّ السَّاعَةَ لَآتِيَةٌ ۖ فَاصْفَحِ الصَّفْحَ الْجَمِيلَ
english: And We have not created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them without any purpose. And the Hour of Resurrection is certainly approaching. So, (O embodiment of excellent morality,) bear with (them) most graciously and effectively with perseverance.

arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ الْخَلَّاقُ الْعَلِيمُ
english: Indeed, your Lord alone is the Creator of all things, All-Knowing.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَاكَ سَبْعًا مِّنَ الْمَثَانِي وَالْقُرْآنَ الْعَظِيمَ
english: And surely We have bestowed upon you the seven oft-recited Verses (i.e., Chapter al-Fatiha) and the Glorious Qur’an.

arabic: لَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِ أَزْوَاجًا مِّنْهُمْ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
english: Do not even lift your eyes towards the things with which We have benefitted the disbelievers for their (few days’) luxury, nor grieve over their (turning away from the straight path), and keep your wings (of affection and care) lowered over the believers (to make them feel contented and cared for).

arabic: وَقُلْ إِنِّي أَنَا النَّذِيرُ الْمُبِينُ
english: And say: ‘Indeed, I am (now) the open and clear Warner (of Allah’s torment).’

arabic: كَمَا أَنزَلْنَا عَلَى الْمُقْتَسِمِينَ
english: The (torment) that We sent down upon the dividers (i.e., the Jews and the Christians),

arabic: الَّذِينَ جَعَلُوا الْقُرْآنَ عِضِينَ
english: Those who divided the Qur’an into pieces (and split it, i.e., accepted the favourable Verses but rejected the others).

arabic: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَسْأَلَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
english: So, by your Lord, We shall indeed interrogate them all,

arabic: عَمَّا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
english: Pertaining to the works that they used to do.

arabic: فَاصْدَعْ بِمَا تُؤْمَرُ وَأَعْرِضْ عَنِ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
english: So declare openly all those (matters) that you have been commanded, and turn away from those who set up partners with Allah.

arabic: إِنَّا كَفَيْنَاكَ الْمُسْتَهْزِئِينَ
english: Surely, We suffice you for (taking them to task) who scoff,

arabic: الَّذِينَ يَجْعَلُونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا آخَرَ ۚ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
english: Who set up other gods along with Allah. So they will come to know (their end) soon.

arabic: وَلَقَدْ نَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ يَضِيقُ صَدْرُكَ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ
english: And We indeed know that your (sacred) breast feels straitened by what they say.

arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَكُن مِّنَ السَّاجِدِينَ
english: So glorify your Lord with His praise and live amongst those who prostrate themselves before Him.

arabic: وَاعْبُدْ رَبَّكَ حَتَّىٰ يَأْتِيَكَ الْيَقِينُ
english: And worship your Lord till you attain to the station of certainty of faith (which goes with your glory, i.e., perfect cognizance of divinity or the moment of far-nearness to your Lord).
